name: bromfenac sodium
indications: bromfenac ophthalmic solution nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory ( nsaid ) indicated treatment postoperative inflammation reduction ocular pain patients undergone cataract surgery . ( 1 )
contraindications: instill one drop affected eye daily beginning 1 day prior surgery , continued day surgery , first 14 days post-surgery . ( 2.1 )
warningsAndPrecautions: bromfenac ophthalmic solution , 0.07 % supplied white low density polyethylene bottle fitted white low density polyethylene nozzle sealed grey colored high density polyethylene cap tamper-evident ring follows : 1.6 ml 5 ml bottle ( ndc 68180-433-01 ) 3 ml 5 ml bottle ( ndc 68180-433-02 ) storage store 25°c ( 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15 30°c ( 59 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] .
indications_original: Bromfenac ophthalmic solution is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) indicated for the treatment of postoperative inflammation and reduction of ocular pain in patients who have undergone cataract surgery. ( 1 )
contraindications_original: Instill one drop into the affected eye once daily beginning 1 day prior to surgery, continued on the day of surgery, and through the first 14 days post-surgery. ( 2.1 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Bromfenac Ophthalmic Solution, 0.07% is supplied in a white low density polyethylene bottle fitted with a white low density polyethylene nozzle and sealed with grey colored high density polyethylene cap with tamper-evident ring as follows:
                  
                     1.6 mL in 5 mL      bottle (NDC 68180-433-01)
                     3      mL in a 5 mL bottle (NDC 68180-433-02) 
                  
                  
                     Storage 
                  
                  Store at 25°C (77°F); excursions permitted to 15 to 30°C (59 to 86°F) [See USP Controlled Room Temperature].
